Uses of Class
com.ontotext.s4.client.RestClientException

  • Packages that use RestClientException 
    Package Description
    com.ontotext.s4.client
    Generic REST client implementation based on HttpURLConnection.

    • Uses of RestClientException in com.ontotext.s4.client

      Methods in com.ontotext.s4.client that throw RestClientException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void RestClient.delete(java.lang.String target)
      Perform an HTTP DELETE request for the given resource.
      <T> T RestClient.get(java.lang.String target, com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference<T> responseType)
      Perform an HTTP GET request, parsing the JSON response to create a new object.
      void RestClient.getForUpdate(java.lang.String target, java.lang.Object responseObject)
      Perform an HTTP GET request, parsing the JSON response to update the state of an existing object.
      java.net.URL RestClient.getRedirect(java.net.URL source)
      Perform an HTTP GET request on a URL whose response is expected to be a 3xx redirection, and return the target redirection URL.
      <T> T RestClient.post(java.lang.String target, com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference<T> responseType, java.lang.Object requestBody)
      Perform an HTTP POST request, parsing the JSON response to create a new object.
      void RestClient.postForUpdate(java.lang.String target, java.lang.Object responseObject, java.lang.Object requestBody)
      Perform an HTTP POST request, parsing the JSON response to update the state of an existing object.
      <T> T RestClient.request(java.lang.String target, java.lang.String method, com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference<T> responseType, java.lang.Object requestBody, java.lang.String... extraHeaders)
      Make an API request and parse the JSON response into a new object.
      java.io.InputStream RestClient.requestForStream(java.lang.String target, java.lang.String method, java.lang.Object requestBody, java.lang.String... extraHeaders)
      Make an API request and return the raw data from the response as an InputStream.
      void RestClient.requestForUpdate(java.lang.String target, java.lang.String method, java.lang.Object responseObject, java.lang.Object requestBody, java.lang.String... extraHeaders)
      Make an API request and parse the JSON response, using the response to update the state of an existing object.
